channel.title: literature on Eejain Huang
channel.description: Recent content in literature on Eejain Huang

item.title: A pond and a river
item.description: .org-center { margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; text-align: center; } I pondered a lot about the pale thin limbs of hers, of curves that blends into mine. I coil around her eyes possessed of a deepest black, soaked with the obsessive fixation on outcry. Yet her blood from screaming is asphalt grey. It’s greying, it’s the grass by the pond. I am in love with her sudden burst of emotion of unknown origin.
